verses.plain: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee:

tokens.t: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what
before thee:

verses.plain: And put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.

tokens.t: And put a knife to thy throat, if thou
a man given to appetite.

verses.plain: Be not desirous of his dainties: for they are deceitful meat.

tokens.t: Be not desirous of his dainties: for they
deceitful meat.

verses.plain: Labour not to be rich: cease from thine own wisdom.

tokens.t: Labour not to be rich: cease from thine own wisdom.

verses.plain: Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? for riches certainly make themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle toward heaven.

tokens.t: Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? for
certainly make themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle toward heaven.

verses.plain: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats:

tokens.t: Eat thou not the bread of
an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats:

verses.plain: For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee.

tokens.t: For as he thinketh in his heart, so
he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart
not with thee.

verses.plain: The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose thy sweet words.

tokens.t: The morsel
thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose thy sweet words.

verses.plain: Speak not in the ears of a fool: for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.

tokens.t: Speak not in the ears of a fool: for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.

verses.plain: Remove not the old landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:

tokens.t: Remove not the old landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:

verses.plain: For their redeemer is mighty; he shall plead their cause with thee.

tokens.t: For their redeemer
mighty; he shall plead their cause with thee.

verses.plain: Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.

tokens.t: Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.

verses.plain: Withhold not correction from the child: for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.

tokens.t: Withhold not correction from the child: for
thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.

verses.plain: Thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.

tokens.t: Thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.

verses.plain: My son, if thine heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine.

tokens.t: My son, if thine heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine.

verses.plain: Yea, my reins shall rejoice, when thy lips speak right things.

tokens.t: Yea, my reins shall rejoice, when thy lips speak right things.

verses.plain: Let not thine heart envy sinners: but be thou in the fear of the LORD all the day long.

tokens.t: Let not thine heart envy sinners: but
in the fear of the
all the day long.

verses.plain: For surely there is an end; and thine expectation shall not be cut off.

tokens.t: For surely there is an end; and thine expectation shall not be cut off.

verses.plain: Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thine heart in the way.

tokens.t: Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thine heart in the way.

verses.plain: Be not among winebibbers; among riotous eaters of flesh:

tokens.t: Be not among winebibbers; among riotous eaters of flesh:

verses.plain: For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty: and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.

tokens.t: For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty: and drowsiness shall clothe
with rags.

verses.plain: Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.

tokens.t: Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.

verses.plain: Buy the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.

tokens.t: Buy the truth, and sell
not;
wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.

verses.plain: The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice: and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him.

tokens.t: The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice: and he that begetteth a wise
shall have joy of him.

verses.plain: Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bare thee shall rejoice.

tokens.t: Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bare thee shall rejoice.

verses.plain: My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.

tokens.t: My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.

verses.plain: For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.

tokens.t: For a whore
a deep ditch; and a strange woman
a narrow pit.

verses.plain: She also lieth in wait as for a prey, and increaseth the transgressors among men.

tokens.t: She also lieth in wait as
a prey, and increaseth the transgressors among men.

verses.plain: Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions? who hath babbling? who hath wounds without cause? who hath redness of eyes?

tokens.t: Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions? who hath babbling? who hath wounds without cause? who hath redness of eyes?

verses.plain: They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to seek mixed wine.

tokens.t: They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to seek mixed wine.

verses.plain: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth his colour in the cup, when it moveth itself aright.

tokens.t: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth his colour in the cup,
it moveth itself aright.

verses.plain: At the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder.

tokens.t: At the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder.

verses.plain: Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thine heart shall utter perverse things.

tokens.t: Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thine heart shall utter perverse things.

verses.plain: Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.

tokens.t: Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.

verses.plain: They have stricken me, shalt thou say, and I was not sick; they have beaten me, and I felt it not: when shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.

tokens.t: They have stricken me,
I was not sick; they have beaten me,
I felt
not: when shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.

footnotes.text: set…: Heb. cause thine eyes to fly upon
even…: or, even I will rejoice
of flesh: Heb. of their flesh
as for…: or, as a robber
the midst…: Heb. the heart of the sea
I felt…: Heb. I knew it not
